direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental for object comparison and hash code generation, often used together in hash-based collections.
Both methods involve hash code computation, with getHash providing a specific hash for map operations.
The put method relies on the hash code to determine the bucket for insertion, making it dependent on the hash code generation logic.
The remove method uses the hash code to locate the bucket for removal, similar to the put method.
The containsKey method uses the hash code to check for the presence of a key in the map.
The get method uses the hash code to locate the bucket and retrieve the value associated with the key.
